page.title: 11 ALL SAINTS CHURCH
page.content: This fine old church dates from the second half of the twelth century and stands on the site of the old village.It contains many interesting features.The oldest parts are the chancel and the south doorway. The octagonal font, after many mishaps,came into the possession of the Jersey family and was given to the church in 1860.It is thought to be that in which Edward the Confessor was baptised. The Jersey chapel was built on the north side of the chancel and contains the family monuments.The crypt is underneath. On the north wall is a list of the Rectors, beginning with Gervasse de Paveley in 1217. The church is open all year round for visitors.
